intro: Luehea divaricata, commonly known as the white mangabey tree, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is smooth and pale, while its wood is valued for its durability and workability. Luehea divaricata is also known for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
